Pre-Game Insights: Zion Williamson will play against Minnesota tonight, marking his first game since November 6 due to a left hamstring strain.
Dejounte Murray highlighted the impact of Williamson's return, noting that it will help open up shots for other players and himself.
Murray expressed happiness for Williamson's return and acknowledged the challenges of recovering from an injury.
Murray praised CJ McCollum for his recent performances, including a 50-point game against Washington.
Minnesota's Anthony Edwards scored a career-high 53 points in a recent game against Detroit and followed it up with 37 points in a win over the Clippers.
Edwards is tied for second in the NBA in clutch points with 70, trailing only Nikola Jokic.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Minnesota is an elite perimeter shooting team, ranking in the top six in all major categories, including fifth in three-point makes and third in percentage.
The Timberwolves have enjoyed lineup continuity with four starters appearing in all 35 games this season.
The Pelicans have used 17 different starting lineups due to numerous injuries.
